refnamediv.refpurpose: Converts a packed internet address to a human readable representation

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.simpara: This function converts a 32bit IPv4, or 128bit IPv6 address (if PHP was built with IPv6 support enabled) into an address family appropriate string representation. Returns &false; on failure.

example.title: inet_ntop Example
example.programlisting:
<?php
$packed = chr(127) . chr(0) . chr(0) . chr(1);
$expanded = inet_pton($packed);

/* Outputs: 127.0.0.1 */
echo $expanded;

$packed = str_repeat(chr(0), 15) . chr(1);
$expanded = inet_pton($packed);

/* Outputs: ::1 */
echo $expanded;
?>

refsect1.para: See also long2ip, inet_pton, and ip2long.
